oop.ex4.data_structures

Class AvlTree

  • Object
    • oop.ex4.data_structures.AvlTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Integer>

    public class AvlTree
extends Object
implements Iterable<Integer>
    An implementation of the AVL tree data structure.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AvlTree()
      The default constructor.
      AvlTree(AvlTree tree)
      A copy constructor that creates a deep copy of the given AvlTree.
      AvlTree(int[] data)
      A constructor that builds a new AVL tree containing all unique values in the input array.

    • Method Summary

      Removes the node with the given value from the tree, if it exists.

      Calculates the minimum number of nodes in an AVL tree of height h.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AvlTree

        public AvlTree()
        The default constructor.

      • AvlTree

        public AvlTree(int[] data)
        A constructor that builds a new AVL tree containing all unique values in the input array.
        Parameters:
        data - the values to add to tree.

      • AvlTree

        public AvlTree(AvlTree tree)
        A copy constructor that creates a deep copy of the given AvlTree. The new tree contains all the values of the given tree, but not necessarily in the same structure.
        Parameters:
        tree - The AVL tree to be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(int newValue)
        Add a new node with the given key to the tree.
        Parameters:
        newValue - the value of the new node to add.
        Returns:
        true if the value to add is not already in the tree and it was successfully added, false otherwise.

      • contains

        public int contains(int searchVal)
        Check whether the tree contains the given input value.
        Parameters:
        searchVal - value to search for
        Returns:
        if val is found in the tree, return the depth of the node (0 for the root) with the given value if it was found in the tree, -1 otherwise.

      • delete

        public boolean delete(int toDelete)
        Removes the node with the given value from the tree, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        toDelete - the value to remove from the tree.
        Returns:
        true if the given value was found and deleted, false otherwise.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        the number of nodes in the tree.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Integer> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<Integer>
        Returns:
        an iterator for the Avl Tree. The returned iterator iterates over the tree nodes in an ascending order, and does NOT implement the remove() method.

      • findMinNodes

        public static int findMinNodes(int h)
        Calculates the minimum number of nodes in an AVL tree of height h.
        Parameters:
        h - the height of the tree (a non-negative number) in question.
        Returns:
        the minimum number of nodes in an AVL tree of the given height.
